description: I can't believe nobody made this sooner. It's too useful. I use Firefox for personal use and Chrome for work, with Firefox as default. Now I can click links in my work messenger instead of copy/paste them.
I didn't know I needed this until I saw it featured on Youtube. Really slick and just does what it should.
Using it with Fedora Silverblue, does what it says.
I use multiple browsers for work and personal time, this makes it so much simpler to manage.
summary: Simple, fast, does what it's supposed to

description: Simple and effective. Awesome for the case when you have separate flows in different browsers

It is amazing how much simpler my life is with Junction. I use Firefox for personal browsing and Chrome for work, and the amount of times I accidentally opened links on the "wrong" browser was really high. Junction provides a very simple, functional, and elegant solution.
summary: A must-have if you need to use multiple browsers

description:
Works great, though it could use some more customization settings. It doesn't display the LibreWolf icon correctly, and theres nothing I can do to fix that as far as I'm aware.

Really simple app though, so theres not much you can go wrong with it. it's worth having even if you only use it for simple things.

Really wish you could set it as the default for images and videos with a click of a button like you can with browsers, though.
Was going to write this app myself, then I found Junction, so now I don't need to. Thanks!
summary: Great for loading different links in different browsers

description: Works like a charm, and its a necessity when you have more than 1 browser installed
Slick interface with full keyboard support. Works great for things like opening links in different browsers or e.g. image files.
It is a simple tool. Being one who uses multiple browsers for different purposes, from user experience wise, it is a major uplift for the whole gnome experience for me.
summary: Simple tool yet great user experience

description: Thank you for your effort.
One app I really missed from MacOS, now the equivalent is here on Linux and works even better than the other one !
Works as expected, I didn't come accross any issues. Thank you dev!

This is a really nicely designed little app that just solves a simple problem in a way that's fantastically intuitive. It's very reliable and well-polished.

Thank you to Sonny Piers for making this
summary: Super reliable, just works, and solves a frustration

description: As someone who uses multiple browsers at once for different reasons this thing is a godsend. No more opening google meet links in the wrong browser.
No tengo nada mas por decir, solo que cumple con lo que promete, Good job
As the description says, I tried to make sure to launch Junction ater installing it, but it won't open any window.
summary: Does not launch on NixOS 23.05 GNOME Wayland

description: I loved the app. Works very smooth
very useful and its something i would very much use
Works well, unintrusive.
Great app when it works. Something changed with Fedora 39/GNOME 45 and it won't open Firefox any longer.
summary: Stopped working on Firefox with Fedora 39/GNOME 45

description: Nice app, but I won't be using it, becouse there is no way to add, remove or rearrange applications in the bar.
Really like the look of this app but it crashes constantly. It cashes when trying to import a few hundred files and also when trying to identify any songs.
extremely handy when you have multiple browsers installed
summary: excellent once you figure out how it works

description: Использую 2 бразуера - для работы и личных дел. Ранее, когда присылали ссылку в тг, приходилось копировать ее и вставлять в нужный браузер, сейчас эта проблема решается в 2 клика.
